{{also|Eine}} ==Estonian== ===Etymology=== Cognate to Finnish {{m|et|eine}}. Possibly a Scandinavian loan, from Proto-Norse {{m|et|*afnija}}. Compare {{cog|sv|ämne||substance}}. See also {{m|et|aine}}. ===Noun=== {{et-noun|eine|einet}} # (light) [[meal]], [[snack]] ====Declension==== {{et-decl-mõte|ein|||e}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|et|hommikueine}} * {{l|et|einestama}} ---- ==Finnish== ===Etymology=== Possibly from {{der|fi|gmq-pro|tr=*afnija}}. Related to {{cog|et|eine}}. ===Pronunciation=== {{fi-pronunciation|*}} ===Noun=== {{fi-noun}} # {{lb|fi|archaic}} [[breakfast]] #: {{syn|fi|aamiainen}} # {{lb|fi|regional}} [[food]] #: {{syn|fi|ruoka}} ====Declension==== {{fi-decl-hame|ein|||ä}} ====Derived terms==== {{der2 |fi|einehtiä |eines }} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|fi|a=eein|-eeni|inee}} ---- ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʔaɪ̯nə/}} * {{audio|de|De-eine.ogg|audio}} ===Numeral=== {{head|de|numeral form}} # {{inflection of|de|ein||nom//acc|f|s}} ===Article=== {{head|de|article form}} # {{inflection of|de|ein||nom//acc|f|s}}: [[a]], [[an]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-ein}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|de|pronoun form}} # {{inflection of|de|einer||str|nom//acc|f|s|;|wk|nom|m|s|;|wk|nom//acc|f//n|s}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-einer}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German articles]] ---- ==Ingrian== ===Etymology=== Akin to {{cog|fi|eine}}. ===Noun=== {{head|izh|noun}} # [[food]] ---- ==Low German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|nds|ene}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nds|/ˈɛɪ̯nə/|/ˈaɪ̯nə/}} ===Article=== {{head|nds|article|g=f|indefinite article}} # [[a]], [[an]] ---- ==Neapolitan== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nap|/eˈinɐ/}} ===Particle=== {{head|nap|particle}} # [[yes]]
